thread.title: Shenendehowa field hockey hoping for deep playoff run
thread.title_full: Shenendehowa field hockey hoping for deep playoff run - Times Union

author: Tom Quinlan
title: Shenendehowa field hockey hoping for deep playoff run
text:
It's cold and windy, and we've already seen a few snow flurries, too.
Maybe you wouldn't want to be running around outside in a field hockey uniform right now, but that's not the case for coach Jeanne Frevola 's Shenendehowa squad.
The Plainsmen clinched the Class A No. 1 seed in the Section II field hockey tournament, and that means more running — possibly between snowflakes — but that's just how they like it.
"We bought the whole team jackets, and the kids are moving out there on the field," Frevola said.
Frevola knows the team's desire to return to the state tournament will keep the Plainsmen playing hard right through November.
Last season, Shenendehowa dropped a 1-0 decision to Saratoga Springs in the Class A title game and missed a chance to repeat as Section II champions.
This year, the Plainsmen finished the regular season 15-1 to earn a bye into the semifinal round.
"We are looking forward to this season progressing, and we're looking forward to putting last season behind us," Frevola added. "We had a hard time scoring last year, and we've worked hard on penalty corners and other areas to improve."
Seniors Emily Fraser , Carli Pelletier, Kelly Barkevich, Kelly Quinn and Kelly Buckley all provide Shenendehowa a solid base.
But one position that always stands out when the frost hits the field is goaltending.
Senior keeper Meredith Koziol picked up right where former standout goalie Melissa Nealon left off; Koziol has recorded 11 shutouts this season.
"Everyone is healthy and playing better than ever," Frevola said.
Her team kept busy during the week off by playing a series of scrimmages and working on conditioning.
It's all a part of getting ready for the road to the states, which for Shenendehowa starts at home Wednesday against fifth-seeded Niskayuna.
tquinlan@timesunion.com
